Leo Davidson.Action: Calms Pericles by stopping his tantrum gently and using a treat as motivation, showing understanding of the chimp's behavior.
Physically takes Pericles’ hand while walking, indicating trust and friendliness.
Interrupts Pericles’ frustration with a firm 'Stop it' and threatens 'no treat', demonstrating control but with no cruelty.
Plays a gentle teasing game with Pericles using a biscuit and patience.
Engages warmly and flirtatiously with Lt. Col. Grace Alexander, smiling and responding positively.
Takes time to find a quiet place to connect with family via a postcard, showing care for personal relationships.
Smiles warmly at his mother's video message, showing affection and connection with family despite distance.
Bangs on the screen when the video feed is interrupted, reacting emotionally to losing contact with loved ones.
Rushes out immediately after the blackout and interrupted communication, indicating concern and urgency about the situation impacting his family.
Argues against standard procedure to send an ape before a manned flight, insisting he should be the one to go first because he can think and do the job properly.
Sarcastically remarks 'Ten billion channels and nothing to watch.' showing wit and situational awareness.
Challenges standard procedures by arguing it is a waste of time to follow them sequentially and suggests sending himself first, claiming he can think and handle the job better.
Refuses to immediately comply with Vasich's order to prepare the ape pilot for the mission, showing confidence but also a degree of insubordination.
Encourages Pericles by smiling and giving a thumbs up before launch, providing reassurance.
Expresses concern quietly, trying to hide it from Pericles to avoid causing alarm.
Shows patience and respect by waiting for orders despite stress when Pericles goes off course.
Volunteers to run sequences in Delta pod after the Alpha pod disappears, taking initiative.
Checks Pericles' flight suit carefully and tries to hide his concern, reassuring Pericles with a smile and thumbs up.
Notices Pericles is off course, immediately communicates this, and attempts to regain control by sliding a red lever.
Expresses frustration and urgency ('Jesus. He's gone.') yet remains focused, indicating awareness and concern despite uncertain circumstances.
Waits for orders despite the emergency and does not prematurely act, showing discipline and deference to command.
Proactively suggests running sequences in Delta pod while waiting for orders, indicating initiative and problem-solving.
Takes initiative to pilot the Delta Pod himself despite risks, showing determination and responsibility.
Dismisses orders with defiant remarks ('Never send a monkey to do a man's job.'), showing brusqueness and some arrogance.
Runs several flight sequence variations and takes initiative to pilot the Delta pod despite objections, showing technical skill and decisiveness.
Hand trembles slightly as he locks the pod door, indicating nervousness but still proceeding with the risky flight.
Responds confidently and defiantly to Vasich's warnings, demonstrating self-assurance and strong resolve.
Maintains communication attempts with Oberon despite heavy static and confusing signals, showing persistence.
Experiences fear for the first time and is visibly panicked when systems shut down and pod tumbles.
Tries to regain control by banging on controls and tries to remove helmet despite failing systems and disorientation.
Successfully fights to engage a manual lever to fire retros after the heat disables the control panel.
Attempts to fire open entry door but finds the hinge melted, then quickly adapts by fumbling underwater for the ejection seat handle and uses it to escape.
Swims for shore and gets up despite injuries, trying to get bearings in unknown jungle.
When confronted by Karubi and his daughter, Leo instinctively raises a stone to defend himself but does not attack and refrains after stone is knocked away.
After being pushed aside by Karubi, Leo does not retaliate but looks around cautiously, eventually following the fleeing humans to safety.
Keeps moving forward to follow and protect the humans despite danger and chaos around him.
Leo keeps moving forward despite the chaos and danger, attempts to defend himself by grabbing a branch and holding it like a spear.
Gets caught off guard and is physically thrown by Attar, ending up stunned on the ground.
Staggers to his feet and runs, takes evasive action to avoid capture in net.
Looks over his shoulder while fleeing, aware of others behind him.
Kneels behind a tree stump to catch his breath, tries to take in and understand the chaotic and dangerous situation.
Launches himself at the ape rider to disrupt the attack and attempts to ride through it, showing protective and proactive behavior.
Maintains eye contact with Thade despite danger, indicating courage and sincerity rather than submission or fear.
Bows his head and cowers with other humans when captured, showing a natural human response to fear but no resistance or defiance in this moment.
Waits until the Ape rides by, then launches himself at the Ape rider, grabbing the reins and knocking the Ape off the horse, flipping onto the horse and trying to ride through an attack.
Is suddenly plucked off the horse by an Ape and dropped hard to the ground.
Maintains eye contact with General Thade, the only human to do so, demonstrating boldness and composure under threat.
Reacts with amazement upon hearing Attar speak, then grabs Attar's wrist in an attempt to connect or assert control.
Allows himself to be swatted away and knocked unconscious by Attar after grabbing him.
Makes eye contact with Ari briefly, showing silent support as she is upset.
Attempts to communicate cautiously with fearful humans, showing concern and seeking connection.
Adheres to Karubi's warning to keep head down and mouth shut, prioritizing group safety over personal expression.
Makes eye contact with Ari, showing awareness and connection despite tense environment.
Approaches and tries to communicate with frightened humans, asking 'Where am I?' and 'What is this place?'
Does not heed Karubi's urgent warning to keep head down and mouth shut, potentially risking safety.
Decides to bide his time instead of reacting impulsively in a tense and dangerous situation.
Observes the mistreatment of humans and appears amazed and concerned by the cruelty around him.
Decides to bide his time and kneels quietly with the others while being captured and processed.
Peeks up cautiously as handlers overwhelm the humans, showing awareness of his surroundings.
Shows amazement at the harshness of the situation but no immediate panic or rash behavior.
Helps the boy Birn to his feet after he is tossed into the pen.
Observes the situation carefully, watching a young ape and her mother with the human children.
Does not intervene when the little human girl is taken and leashed like a pet.
Moves around the pen watching, not sure what's next, indicating concern and attentiveness to the situation.
Resists being dragged to be branded, showing bravery and unwillingness to submit to cruelty.
Does not intervene directly or attempt to stop the branding of Daena despite witnessing it.
Moves around the pen watching, not sure what's next.
Resists being captured but is easily overcome and dragged to the post.
Speaks intensely and asks for help, attempting to protect Ari by pressing the spear to Limbo's neck, showing concern for her safety.
Maintains eye contact on Limbo to control the situation but does not lash out unnecessarily, indicating restraint and sincerity.
Does not retaliate aggressively after being attacked by Limbo and instead is held captive; shows no signs of malice or cruelty.
Presses spear to Limbo's neck and commands him to get back, showing assertiveness and quick reaction.
Fails to notice Limbo using his foot to grab the spear and is quickly overpowered.
Meets Ari's eyes directly and sincerely, causing her to be flustered.
Follows instructions to stand when master enters, showing respect and composure.
No hostile or dismissive reactions to being treated as a 'wild human', remains calm.
Stands and faces Sandar calmly when confronted, meeting Ari's eyes confidently.
Sweeps up the food dropped after being knocked down, quietly preserves a small prong as a keepsake despite humiliation.
Pretends to serve food to avoid conflict when confronted by threatening ape soldiers.
Sweeps up the spilled food and discreetly slips a small prong used as a fork into his shirt while being intimidated by Thade.
Pretends to serve food under Thade's hostile gaze and attempts to hide his face.
Uses a stake to break a slat quietly, enabling escape without alerting guards.
Admits to Daena he is 'just somebody trying to get the hell out of here.'
Seeks help from Daena and accepts companionship on a dangerous escape.
Uses a stake to twist a rope strand tighter until a slat snaps, enabling escape.
Responds confidently when questioned about his identity and purpose.
Does not hesitate or falter under pressure during the escape plan.
Kicks open the attic door and bursts into multiple rooms, disrupting occupants but pursuing his goal.
In the bedroom, quickly grabs a little ape girl who is distressed by the situation.
Kicks open the attic door to gain access quickly despite being confronted by a dizzy teenage ape.
Moves quickly through multiple doors and rooms during a chase, showing agility and decisiveness.
Overturns an ape bust but never stops moving, suggesting urgency and determination.
Bursts into the bedroom and quickly reacts to the situation by grabbing the little ape, showing awareness and protective instinct.
Helps Karubi to his feet despite Karubi's insistence to be left alone, shows care for an injured and tired older man.
Pulls knife preparing for attack, indicating immediate readiness to fight.
Steps closer to Ari and speaks forcefully, unnerving her, pushing for answers about why she saved him.
Acknowledges Ari's act of saving him as unexpected and invites her to come with him to show her something amazing, showing openness and trust.
Hangs from an eave and drops down into the street to lead others, helps Karubi to his feet despite injury, showing leadership and physical capability.
Pulls his knife and prepares to confront approaching apes but is quickly disarmed by Ari, indicating momentary unpreparedness or underestimation.
Speaks quickly and forcefully to Ari to persuade her to help, demonstrating quick thinking and confident communication under pressure.
Questions Ari about why she saved him, seeking understanding, demonstrating curiosity and social intelligence.
Leads Ari and others quickly through the shadows and narrow streets to escape danger.
Leads Ari and others quickly through the shadows and narrow streets to evade hostile apes.
Hears the heart-rending last cry of Karubi and is entrusted with protecting Daena by Krull, showing others trust him.
Does not intervene when Karubi is killed, nor is there an attempt to comfort Daena immediately after, indicating a moment of emotional distance or inability to act.
Hears the last cry of Karubi and is entrusted with Daena by Krull, indicating trust from allies.
Does not directly intervene or attempt to prevent Karubi's death in this excerpt.
Helps Daena to her feet after she is slapped to the ground.
Allows Daena to break free and run off, not restraining her.
Expresses appreciation and acceptance for Krull despite his past, showing open-mindedness and trust.
Helps Daena to her feet after a conflict, showing readiness to assist and intervene appropriately.
Allows Daena to break free and run off after he helped her, indicating a possible failure to control the situation.
Looks back to see if they are being followed and tells others to keep moving.
Doesn't want to deal with Birn's friendly smile and presence.
Keeps moving forward despite exhaustion and potential threats; leads the group through the forest with focus and alertness.
Looks back to check if they are being followed, showing situational awareness.
Tries to explain the crash site and causes confusion among others but maintains confidence.
Leo dives into the bog water despite danger, leading the group and investigating the oil slick.
After discovering threat to Daena, Leo pulls her away from the dead soldier apes to protect her.
Leo mocks the existence of talking monkeys and their world in a dismissive tone.
Traces the streak of black soot to find the oil slick, showing investigative skill.
Dives into the bog despite the known danger that apes cannot swim, demonstrating bravery and confidence in own abilities.
Emerges from underwater carrying a metallic box from the pod, indicating success in a difficult and risky task.
Does not explicitly communicate his plan or concerns before diving, risking group confusion or worry.
Urgently unpacks the emergency box and shares supplies with others, explaining the equipment patiently despite their confusion.
Explains the technology and reassures others using simple, clear language rather than dismissing their confusion as ignorance or superstition.
Refers to controlling the situation as 'we're the 800-pound gorilla,' showing a confident, possibly arrogant stance.
Urgently unpacks the emergency box and sets up a communication device (Messenger), explaining its science clearly to confused humans and apes alike.
Calmly responds to confusion about technology and uses it skillfully despite their amazed or fearful reactions.
Takes initiative to warn others about the apes and asserts control of the situation confidently.
Explains his origin clearly and honestly to Ari and others, showing openness and sincerity.
Quietly prepares a weapon and intervenes during Limbo's attempt to capture Birn, implying protection and willingness to help others.
Refers to the territory as hostile and talks about his own escape, showing some self-interest and urgency but not outright coldness.
Introduces himself confidently as Captain Leo Davidson and provides a clear, imaginative explanation about his origin and mission.
Declares his situation as hostile territory and sets a precise timeline (36 hours) for his objective, indicating situational awareness and planning.
Quietly retrieves a sidearm from the emergency box and prepares it carefully in a tense, hostile environment.
Quickly helps Birn to his feet after confrontation.
Orders removal of Gunnar's shackles.
Throws shackles to Birn so Limbo can be restrained, showing trust in group.
Fires at the ground to warn Limbo instead of escalating violence.
Commands Limbo dismissively ('Find a new trick').
Expresses frustration and screams when Krull destroys his gun, which was vital to his survival.
Commands Limbo effectively, fires warning shot to interrupt Limbo's move, orders removal of Gunnar's shackles, and shows control over the situation.
Shows frustration and anger when Krull smashes his gun, losing temper and failing to control the moment.
Throws shackles to Birn to restrain Limbo, demonstrating quick thinking and leadership under pressure.
Does not prevent Krull from destroying his weapon, thereby losing an important survival tool.
Shuts down arguing between Ari and Daena firmly but impartially, addressing all species equally.
Expresses that he trusts only himself.
Tells others to shut up and asserts his authority confidently: 'Shut up. That goes for all species.'
States he only trusts himself and takes decisive action by picking up the Messenger and hurrying off.
Leo is unsettled but accepts Ari's intimate gesture of handing him water, demonstrating tolerance and respect.
Explains harsh realities about apes in zoos and human cruelty honestly and without defensiveness.
Uses a somewhat dismissive tone ('Get in line') to Ari's curiosity.
Stops to catch his breath while climbing steep mountain slopes but continues with determination.
Reacts unsettled by Ari's intimate manner but still accepts the water offered, maintaining composure.
Patiently answers Ari's numerous questions about zoos and the fate of apes, demonstrating knowledge and willingness to educate.
Acknowledges harsh realities about humanity and animals honestly, reflecting insight and intelligence.
Smiles warmly at Birn, showing friendliness and easing Birn's embarrassment.
Catches Birn when he tumbles down the hill, actively helping and protecting him.
Engages in conversation with Ari about intelligence and sensitivity, responding sincerely.
Shows curiosity about Calima and the apes' culture, demonstrating tolerance and open-mindedness.
Calmly catches Birn as he falls down the steep hill, showing alertness and quick reflexes.
Correctly identifies the ape effigies as not real threats, demonstrating good observation and reasoning.
Asks clarifying questions about Calima and the importance of crossing the ape effigies line, showing curiosity and engagement.
Calms others by assuring that the horses are just animals that will obey commands, countering fearful rumors.
Insists on crossing the river directly despite warnings and suggestions to find another way, showing impatience and disregard for others' concerns.
Confidently decides to go through the ape-guarded camp directly despite suggestions to take a safer, alternative route over the mountains.
Reassures others by rationally dismissing superstitions about the horses and emphasizing practical control over them.
Encourages others to ride the horse despite their fear, offers reassurance and advice.
Wheels the horse around and challenges others to join him, shows leadership and care.
Knocks the soldier back and engages confidently in the fight.
Holds the dun-colored stallion and rides confidently, encouraging others to follow.
Uses knowledge about horses being able to swim to reassure others about crossing the river.
Pushes the hesitant group to move forward despite their fear.
No indication of hesitation or uncertainty in leadership in this excerpt.
Surprises everyone by unlocking Limbo's shackles and letting him ride with the group despite others' doubts.
Uses the phrase 'Attitude is the first human freedom,' showing a confident and motivating attitude but not directly revealing warmth.
Surprises everyone by unlocking Limbo's shackles and deciding to have him ride with the group despite the obvious risk.
Takes the initiative to use a flare gun as a signal or distraction for the plan.
Leads a bold, risky charge with extra horses stampeding through an enemy encampment, demonstrating confident and skillful decision-making.
Ignoring warnings that the plan is suicidal and instead proceeding with it.
Whacks Limbo's horse to carry him to safety during attack.
Ignites an ape tent to create a diversion during escape.
Sees Ari fall and immediately turns to race to her aid.
Whacks Limbo's horse to get him to safety, then ignites an ape tent to create a distraction and helps lead the charge to the river.
Turns his horse and races to aid Ari immediately after she is thrown from her horse.
Grabs Ari's hand firmly and urges her to swim despite her terror, assuring her by saying 'I won't let go of you' before they leap into the river together.
Leaps from his horse, scrambles to Ari, encourages her to swim despite her terror, and takes her hand to jump off the rocks into the river, showing decisive and brave action under pressure.
Carries Ari on his back despite her claws digging into his shoulder.
Reacts with discomfort but allows Daena to rub his shoulders and share a light-hearted moment teasing him.
Engages in friendly, playful interaction with Daena and others, joining in the laughter.
Shows slight discomfort at Ari’s close physical interaction but does not reject or push her away.
Carries Ari on his back despite her claws digging into his shoulder, shows physical endurance and care.
Acknowledges the injuries and allows Daena to treat his wounds.
Is momentarily freaked out by the discussion about Ari being a female chimpanzee, shows emotional hesitation.
Understands the joke and shares a light moment with Daena and others, indicating social awareness and adaptability.
Responds quickly to Tival's signal and prepares to move forward when Ari suggests keeping moving, demonstrating alertness and readiness.
Acknowledges the dangers both he and Ari face in each other's worlds and honestly expresses his limits about taking her with him.
Responds to Ari's hope with a realistic, somewhat guarded statement: 'I never promised anyone anything.'
Recognizes Krull's military behavior and assesses him accurately ('No question, he's army. I know the type.')
Assesses danger realistically to Ari about visiting his world, showing insight ('You'd never be able to go home again.')
Refuses to make promises he can't keep and manages expectations about saving others ('I never promised anyone anything.')
Shows emotional restraint despite Ari's subtle pleading and emotional moment
Leads the others over a ridge confidently and uses the Messenger device to track the beacon signal.
Moves faster and faster, excitedly chasing the beacon signal, expecting to find the crew.
Upon realizing the crew is not there, he does not immediately respond verbally but shows visible signs of disbelief and concern.
Kneels and digs up a human skull, showing respect and gravity for the discovery.
Works frantically to uncover metallic objects and a connection to his past, showing dedication and sincerity in understanding the situation.
Reacts with disbelief and emotional struggle upon reconciling the cave and Oberon emblem with his memories, indicating vulnerability and openness.
Recognizes the cave and the significance of the Oberon emblem, demonstrating memory and observation.
Frantically scrapes at the wall to uncover hidden objects despite the impossible revelation, showing determination and problem-solving skill.
Interacts cautiously with unfamiliar technology, such as the hand ID system, and patiently waits for a response.
Drops the human skull upon finding it, suggesting a momentary emotional shock or hesitation.
Quickly figures out how to operate the ship's control panel despite the dusty, ancient environment, accessing and lighting up the bridge systems.
Successfully locates and accesses the ship's visual log database, understanding its purpose and function.
Interprets and connects the data from the Messenger beacon tracking to the Oberon ship, showing analytical and technical skills.
Remains determined to uncover the story behind the ship's fate despite confusing and challenging technological clues.
Does not hesitate or show confusion when confronting unfamiliar technology or data, proceeding confidently to manipulate controls.
Stares stunned and glistening-eyed at his own missing-in-action status, showing vulnerability.
Fumbles with ship’s gauges trying to find a way to save the crew and leave the planet, indicating care and responsibility.
Shows a longing to return home after being away for a thousand years, revealing sincerity and emotional openness.
Continues to search through damaged and static-filled logs trying to find useful information despite difficulty.
Stops at his own name labeled as missing in action, visibly stunned and emotional.
Attempts to console himself and is consoled by Ari, showing the emotional impact but remaining functional.
Fumbles with gauges, notices fuel rod power status indicating an attempt to find solutions to leave.
Shows longing and emotional vulnerability about being away from home for a long time.
Pushes forward into the crowd of humans who greet him warmly, showing willingness to engage with them despite the tense situation.
Tells others to send humans back despite their having left their homes to find him, showing some lack of consideration for their plight.
Looks on with concern while watching the expanse from the cliff at sunset, indicating sincere worry about his situation and those around him.
Advises Daena to get her people to safety and offers to draw the enemy away to protect them.
Acknowledges the humans' fear and hesitation but still tries to lead by example, showing care for their lives.
Insists on fighting alone and puts himself at risk to protect others, demonstrating selflessness and trustworthiness.
Observes the humans silently refusing to leave and tries to communicate the seriousness of their situation, showing concern and sincerity.
Analyzes the threat, decides to have Daena's people hide to preserve their lives.
Offers to draw enemy forces away himself, accepting a dangerous but strategic role.
Attempts to command the humans to scatter, but recognizes when they refuse to act and tries to communicate the seriousness of the situation again.
Initially issues orders the humans don’t follow, showing some difficulty in motivating or leading them effectively.
Gives clear instructions to his followers, showing care for their safety by placing people behind the ship to be protected.
Refuses to let Birn take unnecessary risks despite Birn's protest, showing responsibility and concern for others.
Shows a moment of doubt and hesitation before acting, indicating thoughtfulness and sincerity.
Gives clear, confident instructions to his followers, showing leadership and strategic thinking.
Takes charge in preparing for a risky plan, indicating confidence and decisiveness.
Demonstrates control by cutting off Birn's protests firmly to maintain order.
Works alone on technical controls with a moment of doubt, indicating some uncertainty but persistence.
Recognizes the high stakes and admits he can only attempt the risky technology once, showing awareness of limitations.
Attempts to inspire confidence by referencing the Spartans holding off an army and becoming legends, demonstrating strategic use of historical analogy.
Continues to check the controls on his Messenger Pack under rising panic, showing calmness and focus under pressure.
Signals and coordinates the riders to escape the approaching ape lopers by dividing into two groups heading for safety behind the ruins.
Uses his Messenger device to continue monitoring the situation while maintaining situational awareness.
Leaps from cover and runs hard into the open to try to save Birn from the charging apes, showing decisive action.
Runs full out to reach Birn and free him from danger before the apes attack.
Leaps from cover and runs hard into the open to rescue Birn and reach the messenger before apes catch him.
Attempts to activate the messenger device under pressure, showing persistence despite initial failure.
Successfully triggers the ship's engines to explode to life, vaporizing many enemies and turning the tide.
Steps out from the rocks to face danger, listens and assesses the situation calmly.
In the thick of battle, defends himself effectively and sprints forward to confront danger.
Kicks away a spear stab in the thick of battle, rolls under attack, grabs the spear, and sprints forward.
Holds up a hand to stop Limbo from greedily collecting weapons, showing control and situational awareness.
Observes Thade’s bluff and understands it immediately, showing insight and tactical awareness.
Throws dirt into the ape's eyes and stabs him with a spear, then takes his net.
Helped Daena from the horse and supported her despite the chaos of battle.
Engages in hand-to-hand combat with Thade and continues to get up despite being knocked down twice.
Seems overwhelmed and about to be finished off by Thade before the battle is interrupted.
Maintains focus and clarity of mind when facing an unknown fast-approaching threat.
Runs to the pod and warmly acknowledges Pericles with praise and encouragement ('Good boy').
Shares an encouraging thumbs up with Pericles, showing a friendly and trusting bond.
Runs to the pod without hesitation upon recognizing it and quickly forms a positive connection with Pericles, demonstrating quick situational awareness.
Interprets Pericles' thumb signal correctly and reacts confidently by acknowledging it and encouraging him.
Seizes opportunity symbolized by Pericles' return in the pod, showing hopeful and proactive leadership.
Strides towards enemies to explain evolution, showing bravery and a desire to communicate and educate rather than fight aggressively.
Runs for safety after being violently attacked but does not retaliate viciously, indicating restraint and self-preservation.
Lures Thade toward the Oberon's bridge, using tact and caution in a hostile situation.
Attempts furtively to reach into Pericles' backpack under threat, showing quick thinking but also an element of secrecy.
Slings Pericles' backpack over his shoulder and approaches hostile apes confidently to explain evolution, showing leadership and initiative.
Runs and retreats strategically, luring Thade closer to the Oberon's bridge rather than standing and fighting head-on.
Attempts to furtively reach into the backpack despite being at risk, showing resourcefulness and situational awareness.
Pretends to be worried while Thade examines the green glow stick, using deception to create an opportunity to escape.
Gets thrown and hit multiple times by Thade, takes terrible falls, but does not give up; shows resilience but physical incapacity against a stronger opponent.
Saves Ari by pointing a gun at Thade, but chooses not to shoot to avoid harming her.
Speaks quickly to Attar, reminding him of their shared peaceful past and urging him to reconsider hostility.
Maneuvers Thade away from Ari and Attar to protect them, presses his hand to the wall to trap Thade.
Grabs Ari and pulls her to safety as the security door closes.
Takes Pericles' hand and smiles at him, showing gentle care and connection.
Hands Pericles over to Ari, trusting her to care for him and showing concern for Pericles' welfare.
Decides to leave despite Ari's emotional plea to stay, prioritizing a chance to return home over the emotional ties, showing a measured but somewhat distant choice.
Rejects Limbo's sentimental gift, pressing the emblem back into his hand.
Comforts Daena as she breaks down and holds her tight despite knowing he can't take her with him.
Backs up and then sprints for the pod when the beeping increases frequency, showing urgency and quick reaction.
Refuses to take Limbo's Oberon emblem, showing emotional boundaries and focus on the mission.
Acknowledges he can't take Daena with him, demonstrating realistic decision-making despite emotional difficulty.
Struggles to map his coordinates in space and receives a message 'COORDINATES UNKNOWN', indicating inability to navigate or lack of information.
Leo fights to control the pod despite dangerous conditions to safely land on Earth, showing determination and responsibility.
Upon seeing police apes approaching, Leo initially runs toward them but then stops and flees when confronted with hostility.
Fights to hold the pod steady during turbulent atmospheric entry and fires retro burners to slow descent.
Directs the pod toward faint landing strip-like lights despite thick cloud cover and loss of horizon.
Immediately starts running towards approaching figures after crash landing, showing initiative and readiness to interact.
Stops running upon realizing the figures are hostile apes and then retreats to a defensive position in the Lincoln Memorial, demonstrating situational awareness and caution.
Fights the apes as best he can despite being exhausted and outnumbered.
Gets caught and subdued by the apes.
